posts.post_content:
The Signets were always/have always been/will always be great, but they are especially relevant now as Color Fixers in Commander decks that want to play 20-30 gold cards, or Commander decks who ABSOLUTELY have to cast their 2-or-3 colored Commander by turn 5 at the latest.  
  
If number of mana is your problem, Sol Ring is great at breaking....most things.  
  
But in situations where getting the right colors fast is important: the Signets are, actually, better than Sol Ring.  
  
Not STRICTLY better. But if I was playing Kaalia of the Vast, I would take any Signet over Sol Ring in the opening 7. That's quite a testament to their power and utility, and whichever one you think is most useless (G/B maybe? Those colors are combo-riffic, so good aggro cards look 'bad', and Green has much faster mana ramp) anyway whichever Signet you think is the WORST gets 3.5 stars for being competitive with Sol Ring, and [Dimir Signet](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dimir Signet) is no less than 4.5 stars at a minimum. U/B has a lot of mana... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
